item.title: Google rolls out text-to-image model Imagen 4 for free
item.dc:creator: Mayank Parmar
item.description: Google confirmed that Imagen 4, which is the company's state-of-the-art text-to-image, is rolling out for free, but only on AI Studio. [...]

item.title: Claude catches up to ChatGPT with built-in memory support
item.dc:creator: Mayank Parmar
item.description: AI startup Anthorpic is planning to add a memory feature to Claude in a bid to take on ChatGPT, which has an advanced memory feature. [...]

item.title: Google Cloud donates A2A AI protocol to the Linux Foundation
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Google Cloud has donated its Agent2Agent (A2A) protocol to the Linux Foundation, which has now announced a new community-driven project called the Agent2Agent Project. [...]

item.title: SonicWall warns of trojanized NetExtender stealing VPN logins
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: SonicWall is warning customers that threat actors are distributing a trojanized version of its NetExtender SSL VPN client used to steal VPN credentials. [...]

item.title: Windows 10 KB5061087 update released with 13 changes and fixes
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Microsoft has released the June 2025 non-security preview update for Windows 10, version 22H2, with fixes for bugs preventing the Start Menu from launching and breaking scanning features on USB multi-function printers. [...]

item.title: Microsoft fixes known issue that breaks Windows 11 updates
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Microsoft is rolling out a configuration update designed to address a known issue causing Windows Update to fail on some Windows 11 systems. [...]

item.title: Windows 10 users can get extended security updates using Microsoft points
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Microsoft says Windows 10 home users who want to delay switching to Windows 11 can enroll in the Extended Security Updates (ESU) program at no additional cost using Microsoft Rewards points or enabling Windows Backup to sync their data to the cloud. [...]

item.title: Trezor’s support platform abused in crypto theft phishing attacks
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Trezor is alerting users about a phishing campaign that abuses its automated support system to send deceptive emails from its official platform. [...]

item.title: New FileFix attack weaponizes Windows File Explorer for stealthy commands
item.dc:creator: Ionut Ilascu
item.description: A cybersecurity researcher has developed FileFix, a variant of the ClickFix social engineering attack that tricks users into executing malicious commands via the File Explorer address bar in Windows. [...]

item.title: How Today’s Pentest Models Compare and Why Continuous Wins
item.dc:creator: Sponsored by Sprocket Security
item.description: Legacy pentests give you a snapshot. Attackers see a live stream. Sprocket's Continuous Penetration Testing (CPT) mimics real-world attackers—daily, not annually—so you can fix what matters, faster. Learn why CPT is the future. [...]

item.title: US House bans WhatsApp on staff devices over security concerns
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: The U.S. House of Representatives has banned the installation and use of WhatsApp on government-issued devices belonging to congressional staff, citing concerns over how the app encrypts and secures data. [...]

item.title: APT28 hackers use Signal chats to launch new malware attacks on Ukraine
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: The Russian state-sponsored threat group APT28 is using Signal chats to target government targets in Ukraine with two previously undocumented malware families named BeardShell and SlimAgent. [...]

item.title: Malware on Google Play, Apple App Store stole your photos—and crypto
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: A new mobile crypto-stealing malware called SparkKitty was found in apps on Google Play and the Apple App Store, targeting Android and iOS devices. [...]
